parameters.name: AuthorizationScopes
parameters.description: The authorization scopes supported by this route. (string) --- A string with a length between [1-64].

parameters.name: RequestModels
parameters.description: The request models for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs. (string) --- (string) --- A string with a length between [1-128].

parameters.name: RequestParameters
parameters.description: The request parameters for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs. (string) --- (dict) --- Validation constraints imposed on parameters of a request (path, query string, headers). Required (boolean) --- Whether or not the parameter is required.

nested_params.name: Required
nested_params.description: Whether or not the parameter is required.

nested_items.name: ApiGatewayManaged
nested_items.description: Specifies whether a route is managed by API Gateway. If you created an API using quick create, the $default route is managed by API Gateway. You can't modify the $default route key.

nested_items.name: ApiKeyRequired
nested_items.description: Specifies whether an API key is required for this route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs.

nested_items.name: AuthorizationScopes
nested_items.description: A list of authorization scopes configured on a route. The scopes are used with a JWT authorizer to authorize the method invocation. The authorization works by matching the route scopes against the scopes parsed from the access token in the incoming request. The method invocation is authorized if any route scope matches a claimed scope in the access token. Otherwise, the invocation is not authorized. When the route scope is configured, the client must provide an access token instead of an identity token for authorization purposes.

nested_items.name: AuthorizationType
nested_items.description: The authorization type for the route. For WebSocket APIs, valid values are NONE for open access, AWS_IAM for using AWS IAM permissions, and CUSTOM for using a Lambda authorizer For HTTP APIs, valid values are NONE for open access, JWT for using JSON Web Tokens, AWS_IAM for using AWS IAM permissions, and CUSTOM for using a Lambda authorizer.

nested_items.name: AuthorizerId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Authorizer resource to be associated with this route. The authorizer identifier is generated by API Gateway when you created the authorizer.

nested_items.name: ModelSelectionExpression
nested_items.description: The model selection expression for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs.

nested_items.name: OperationName
nested_items.description: The operation name for the route.

nested_items.name: RequestModels
nested_items.description: The request models for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs.

nested_items.name: RequestParameters
nested_items.description: The request parameters for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs.

nested_items.name: Required
nested_items.description: Whether or not the parameter is required.

nested_items.name: RouteKey
nested_items.description: The route key for the route.

nested_items.name: RouteResponseSelectionExpression
nested_items.description: The route response selection expression for the route. Supported only for WebSocket APIs.
